oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Country Cookin' radio pitch - Lee Arnold - U. S. Army Reserve
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of a pitch for radio program Country Cookin', featuring Lee Arnold (host), interviews with George Jones (performer), Tammy Wynette (performer), and record excerpts. Sponsored by the U. S. Army Reserve.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:02) Lee Arnold pitch for radio program Country Cookin' -- (02:30) Opening theme -- (02:33) Opening statement (Lee Arnold) -- (02:59) Lee Arnold introduces George Jones and Tammy Wynette -- (03:29) Tammy Wynette talks about when she got her first big break filling in for Norma Jean with Porter Wagoner -- (05:20) U. S. Army Reserve recruitment advertisement (Lee Arnold) -- (06:23) Apartment #9 (Tammy Wynette) [recording] -- (07:02) Lee Arnold introduces the next tune -- (07:19) Nothing Ever Hurt Me (Half As Bad As Losing You) [George Jones] [recording excerpt] -- (07:54) Lee Arnold talks about how widely respected George Jones is in the music industry -- (08:09) Wynette talks about being a fan of Jones for a long time -- (08:40) Jones talks about the song Window Up Above and She Thinks I Still Care being some of his favorite songs he has recorded -- (09:09) Jones talks about his songwriting process -- (10:00) U. S. Army Reserve recruitment advertisement and jingle (Lee Arnold) -- (10:35) We Believe In Each Other (George Jones, Tammy Wynette) [recording] -- (11:34) Closing statement (Lee Arnold)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Arnold, Lee (Disc jockey); Jones, George, 1931-2013; Wynette, Tammy, 1942-1998;
